intro: Mimulus szechuanensis, commonly known as the Sichuan monkeyflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It features vibrant orange to yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
